name: WASP-47
scenarioDescription:
The WASP-47 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-47 is a star with 1.04 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.14 times its radius. It is located 869.83 light years away from the solar system.

WASP-47 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-47 system


WASP-47 c

WASP-47 c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.39 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-47 c is 398.41265999999996 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-47 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-47, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by La Silla Observatory.
